data.text:
August Victoria Memorial game guide (2024 update)



Victoria Memorial Opening Times

Year round : Open all day



Victoria Memorial Address

London SW1A 1AA, United Kingdom



Suggested Visit Duration for Victoria Memorial

1-2 hours

󰪶

Typical Itinerary for Victoria Memorial

The Queen Victoria Memorial is a large monument and sculpture complex in London, England, built in 1911. The base of the monument is made of 2,300 tons of white marble. The center of the monument is the main monument, and at the bottom is a large white marble seated statue of Queen Victoria and the statues of the Angels of Justice and Truth. At the top is a gilt statue of the goddess of victory and two attendants. The base around the main monument consists of steps and pools. At the four corners of the pedestal are a group of bronze statues of human and lions, one of which was donated by the people of New Zealand. The decoration of the entire monument focuses on the nautical theme, echoing the Admiral's Gate at the other end of the boulevard. The monument is surrounded by flower beds, and the whole area is called "Queen's Garden". The front (northeast) of the Queen's Garden is the tree-lined road, the front right is St James's Park, and the right is Australia Gate. Behind (to the southwest) is Buckingham Palace. On the left is Canada Gate, and behind it is Green Park. Front left is St James's Palace.



Food and service are very good, I will definitely come to this restaurant next time. Call 20 minutes in advance, and then happily found that a good table next to the window was reserved for us. Thanks to Henrik, it was the best dinner experience we had during this tour in the past week.

没有蜡olling : -Seven Park Place There are three desserts for a total of eight dishes [cover mouth] The front dishes, desserts and I like the Michelin restaurant really don't suit me. It took more than 3 hours for a meal. I really can't sit still and wait [laughs cry] ​



Verified Reviews of Victoria Memorial



Trip Moments Involving Victoria Memorial



Consider London for Your Next Trip

The Buckingham Palace, with its iconic Changing of the Guard ceremony, is the official residence of the British monarch. Marvel at the grandeur of this architectural masterpiece, and witness the precision and pageantry of the guards as they carry out their ceremonial duties. Nearby, the majestic Victoria Memorial stands as a tribute to Queen Victoria, an emblem of the city's rich history. Admire the magnificent St. Paul's Cathedral with its impressive dome dominating the city's skyline and offering breathtaking views from the Golden Gallery. Or visit one of over 200 museums with 11 national museums including the British Museum. #visitlondon

daniil.vya

7



Also Popular With Visitors to Victoria Memorial

1 . Tower Bridge

Price : $16.20

Recommended sightseeing time: : 1-2 hours

Address : Tower Bridge Rd, London SE1 2UP, United Kingdom

Distance : 2.17 mi

What travelers say :

_TS***7p : A bit expensive for what you get. Less than an hour was needed. It was a great visit. There were great views. And try as I might. I still cannot walk on those glass floors. I enjoyed the views and being in a historic building but .. it was fast up an elevator , across twice . And Down the stairs and walk over to the engine room and done. I can say I did it but it should have cost a bit less.

2 . Thames River Cruise

Price : $11.52

Recommended sightseeing time: : 1.5-3 hours

Address : Westminster Pier, Victoria Embankment, London SW1A 2JH, United Kingdom

Distance : 740m

What travelers say :

anyaduck : The first day I arrived in London, I was just near the Tower Bridge. I wanted to take a cruise to feel the summer breeze of the evening of the Thames. I bought a ticket. As a result, I issued a ticket for ten minutes. The pier actually waited for more than half an hour. It was wasted a long time on the pier. Cruise to the second floor, the two sides of the famous buildings, the attractions have a panoramic view, there is a crew explain, just their English too food, fans can only understand some attraction names and key words, many stories or historical backgrounds really do not know the cloud...

3 . The Shard

Price : $41.23

Recommended sightseeing time: : 1-2 hours

Address : 32 London Bridge St, London SE1 9SG, United Kingdom

Distance : 1.7 mi

What travelers say :

madalinamaria10 : intresting place to see the city from a very high point, good photo opportunity however, staying more than half an hour at the top will probably bore you.

4 . Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew

Price : $20.41

Recommended sightseeing time: : 2-3 hours

Address : Richmond, United Kingdom

Distance : 1.25 mi

What travelers say :

MaxS : The Royal Botanic Gardens Kew is one of the many and most beautiful parks in London, located on the south bank of the Thames in the southwestern suburbs between Kew and Richmond. The park covers an area of more than 130 hectares.The Royal Botanic Gardens Kew included in the UNESCO World Heritage List since 2003, has the world's largest collection of living plants — more than 30,000 species from all over the planet, about 750 researchers also work here, and about 7 million plant samples are located in herbariums.The Royal Botanic Gardens Kew, being a complex of botanical gardens, greenhouses and greenhouses, are also considered a very important research and educational center. In addition, you can see many architectural structures and attractions of various styles in the park.
